Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a carinated body and a long tubular nozzle, now broken. The upper body is decorated with radiating cables. At the rear is a plastic handle-grip modelled in the form of a sexual attack by a horse on a man with a colossal phallus. Within the oval base-ring is the letter B in relief.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q552.bis)
